sen.j: 難波三綱（なにわのみつな、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: NANIWA no Mitsuna (date of birth and death unknown) lived in the Asuka period in Japan.
NANIWA no Mitsuna (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: NANIWA no Mitsuna (date of birth and death unknown) lived during Japan's Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「なにはのみつな」。
sen.e: His name is pronounced "NANIHA no Mitsuna" in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced "NANIHA no Mitsuna" in the old Japanese kana syllabary.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: His name is pronounced "NANIHA no Mitsuna" in the old Japanese kana syllabary.
His hereditary title was Kishi (one of the lower title under Yamato dynasty).
His hereditary title was Kishi (one of the lower title under Yamato dynasty).
His hereditary title was Kishi (one of the lower title under Yamato dynasty).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側につき、都を脱出した大津皇子に同行した。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War in 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu who escaped from the capital.
He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: He followed Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) in the Jinshin War of 672 and accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.

sen.j: 難波氏は渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: Naniwa clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Naniwa clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.
Naniwa clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、三綱は近江宮がある大津市にいたらしい。
sen.e: It is supposed that Mitsuna was in Otsu City where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started,
It is supposed that Mitsuna was in Otsu where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started,
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。「大津市」はリンク表記でWeb上でも当時の地名の「大津」なのでCityは削除しました。
sen.e: It is supposed that Mitsuna was in Otsu where Omi no miya was located when the Jinshin War started,

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵を決めたとき、その子高市皇子と大津皇子も敵の本拠である大津にいた。
sen.e: When the Prince Oama decided to raise an army, his children, Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu were in Otsu city where the enemy's headquarters was located.
When Prince Oama decided to raise an army, his children, Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu, were in Otsu where the enemy's headquarters was located.
sen.cmt: the は削除しました。ここでもcityは削除しました。
sen.e: When Prince Oama decided to raise an army, his children, Prince Takechi and Prince Otsu, were in Otsu where the enemy's headquarters was located.

sen.j: 二人はともども都を脱し、二手に分かれて父のあとを追った。
sen.e: The two princes escaped from the capital separately and ran after their father.
The two princes escaped from the capital separately and ran after their father.
The two princes escaped from the capital separately and ran after their father.

sen.j: 難波三綱は大津皇子の一行に加わり、25日深夜に伊勢国の鈴鹿関に到達し、翌朝朝明郡の迹太川の辺で合流を果たした。
sen.e: NANIWA no Mitsuna joined Prince Otsu's party and arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise at midnight of 25th and joined his father's party next morning around Toho-gawa River.

NANIWA no Mitsuna joined Prince Otsu's party and arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise at midnight of 25th and joined his father's party next morning at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori County.

NANIWA no Mitsuna joined Prince Otsu's party and arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in Ise at midnight of 25th and joined his father's party next morning at the bank of Toho-gawa River in Asake-no-kori County.

sen.j: ともに朝明郡にたどりついたのは、大津皇子のほかに、大分恵尺、駒田忍人、山辺安摩呂、小墾田猪手、埿部視枳、大分稚臣、根金身、漆部友背であった。
sen.e: The followers who got to Asake-no-kori county with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi and NE no Kanemi and NURIBE no Tomose.

The followers who got to Asake-no-kori County with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi and NURIBE no Tomose.
sen.cmt: andをひとつ削除しました。
sen.e: The followers who got to Asake-no-kori County with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi and NURIBE no Tomose.

sen.j: この後の内戦で難波三綱が果たした活動については記録がない。
sen.e: No records of NANIWA no Mitsuna' activities in the later domestic warfare were kept.
There is no records of NANIWA no Mitsuna' subsequent activities in this domestic warfare.
sen.cmt: 「この後の内戦」の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: There is no records of NANIWA no Mitsuna' subsequent activities in this domestic warfare.
